item.title: 3 years sL
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:96, topic:396887”]Unlike Kaitnieks or these forums, social networks like facebooks make billions in revenue, so as long as that money is in the business they have no need to close down. Most social networks were quid fads but facebook seems to be here to stay, and I think thats largely due in part to its tremendous business success.

I believe it’ll be around for decades, but I imagine when we are old it will be nothing like it is today. If i had to hazard a guess, I’d say they will probably setup an obituary part of the site for profiles of deceased users.[/quote]

If you would have asked most people in, say, 2005ish?, they probably would have said the same thing about myspace, right?

Read full topic

item.title: 3 years sL
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Unlike Kaitnieks or these forums, social networks like facebooks make billions in revenue, so as long as that money is in the business they have no need to close down. Most social networks were quid fads but facebook seems to be here to stay, and I think thats largely due in part to its tremendous business success.

I believe it’ll be around for decades, but I imagine when we are old it will be nothing like it is today. If i had to hazard a guess, I’d say they will probably setup an obituary part of the site for profiles of deceased users.

Read full topic
